truffle-teams-gets-a-new-look.title: Truffle Teams Gets a New Look!

unwrap-the-corda-flavored-ganache-beta.author: Josh Quintal

take-control-of-your-deployments-with-tr.title: Take Control of Your Deployments with Truffle Teams
take-control-of-your-deployments-with-tr.author: Mike Seese
take-control-of-your-deployments-with-tr.excerpt: Truffle Teams now gives you a dead-simple deployment experience. You push a couple of buttons, send transactions with MetaMask, and badabing, your contracts are on a public Ethereum network.

using-the-ens-integration.title: Using Truffle's ENS Integration
using-the-ens-integration.author: Tyler Feickert
using-the-ens-integration.excerpt: Truffle's ENS integration allows you to use ENS names in your migrations! You can also set addresses for ENS names that you own.

truffle-teams-now-supports-private-repos.title: Truffle Teams Now Supports Private Repositories
truffle-teams-now-supports-private-repos.author: Josh Quintal and Mike Seese
truffle-teams-now-supports-private-repos.excerpt: We're excited to announce that you can now integrate private repositories with Truffle Teams! This will eventually be a premium feature, but we're releasing it for free while the product is still in beta.

drizzle-150-a-new-beginning.title: Drizzle 1.5.0: A new beginning
drizzle-150-a-new-beginning.author: Adrian Li
drizzle-150-a-new-beginning.excerpt: Drizzle gets migrated to a monorepo with a focus on regular releases and a better contributor experience.

using-truffle-to-interact-with-chainlink.title: Using Truffle to interact with Chainlink Smart Contracts
using-truffle-to-interact-with-chainlink.author: Chainlink, Guest Blogger
using-truffle-to-interact-with-chainlink.excerpt: Chainlink is one of the leading blockchain projects building the very first decentralized oracle network that provides external data to smart contracts. Truffle helps smart contract developers by providing a powerful framework to create, test, and deploy smart contracts.

3-ways-enterprises-are-addressing-blockc.title: 3 Ways Enterprises Are Addressing Blockchain Privacy Concerns
3-ways-enterprises-are-addressing-blockc.author: Danny Pan, Guest Blogger, West Monroe Partners
3-ways-enterprises-are-addressing-blockc.excerpt: This year has seen numerous announcements of single and multi-party blockchain pilots by the Fortune 500 such as‚Ä¶ Starbucks and MetLife. Data privacy issues haven‚Äôt stopped them and the enterprise blockchain world has taken these steps to shift their thinking.

crytic-continuous-assurance-for-smart-co.title: Crytic: Continuous Assurance for Smart Contracts
crytic-continuous-assurance-for-smart-co.author: Josselin Feist, Guest Blogger, Senior Security Engineer from Trail of Bits
crytic-continuous-assurance-for-smart-co.excerpt: We at Trail of Bits are proud to announce our new Smart contract security product: https://crytic.io/. Crytic provides continuous assurance for smart contracts. The platform reports build status on every commit and runs a suite of security analyses for immediate feedback.

upcoming-improvements-to-encoding-and-de.title: Upcoming improvements to encoding and decoding
upcoming-improvements-to-encoding-and-de.author: Harry Altman
upcoming-improvements-to-encoding-and-de.excerpt: When you‚Äôre writing, running, or debugging your smart contract, you don‚Äôt want to have to deal with raw binary data. Truffle‚Äì‚Äìand Ganache and Drizzle‚Äì‚Äìalready contain a number of encoding and decoding features to help you interact with your contract and understand what you‚Äôre seeing. But luckily, encoding and decoding are about to become even more robust, informative, and usable.

token-taxonomy-framework.title: Token Taxonomy Framework
token-taxonomy-framework.author: Marley Gray, Guest Blogger, Microsoft, Principal Architect - Azure Blockchain
token-taxonomy-framework.excerpt: To some, the sudden rise of Tokens in the blockchain dialog comes as a surprise. However, tokens have always been the bedrock of the blockchain movement. The introduction of SmartContract by Ethereum quickly overshadowed them, particularly in enterprise contexts. The capabilities of Smart Contracts and the broad acceptance of them, thanks to companies like Truffle, blazed a trail forward and we all went along. It wasn‚Äôt until we got halfway up the trail that someone turned around and asked, ‚Äúdid we pack any trail mix?‚Äù

axonis-enterprise-use-of-truffle.title: Axoni's Enterprise Use of Truffle
axonis-enterprise-use-of-truffle.author: Jonathan Leslie, Guest Blogger, a Lead Software Engineer from Axoni
axonis-enterprise-use-of-truffle.excerpt: At Axoni, our mission is to make shared information more trusted and reliable. We do this through distributed technology that we call "Ethereum-inspired"...given our compliance with the web3 JSON-RPC spec, Truffle basically works "out-of-the-box". However `truffle migrate` was less extensible, so we built a Truffle-based deployment tool.

open-call-for-contributions-truffle-pega.title: Open call for contributions by Truffle + PegaSys: EEA private transactions
open-call-for-contributions-truffle-pega.author: Felipe Faraggi, Guest Blogger, Developer Evangelist from PegaSys

Not only are we trying to keep up with technologies like blockchain, machine learning, and AI, but we have an overwhelming amount of information on the web all at the click of a mouse.

blockchain-will-cure-cancer.title: Blockchain Will Cure Cancer
blockchain-will-cure-cancer.author: Faina Shalts
blockchain-will-cure-cancer.excerpt: Physicians and scientists will be the actual agents behind a cure for cancer. But in their potential to disrupt the very nature of medical research and treatment, blockchain-based solutions are extremely likely to light the way. It is important when examining any new technology to consider the ways in which it may change the world. Join me here as we briefly look at how blockchain can help lead us to a world without cancer.

drizzle-vue-a-truffle-story.title: Drizzle Vue: A Truffle Story
drizzle-vue-a-truffle-story.author: Amal Sudama

Unfortunately, I knew nothing about Vue. In previous organizations I was a part of, I would have shied away from pursuing this project. However, at Truffle I felt comfortable and empowered to champion the idea.

an-easier-way-to-deploy-your-smart-contr.title: An Easier Way to Deploy Your Smart Contracts
an-easier-way-to-deploy-your-smart-contr.author: Mike Seese
an-easier-way-to-deploy-your-smart-contr.excerpt: Deploying your smart contracts shouldn't be difficult, and the process should be flexible. why-i-love-trufflecon.author: Josh Quintal
why-i-love-trufflecon.excerpt: TruffleCon is a conference, sure, but it's more than that: it's the feeling of excitement when learning a new technology; the eureka we felt when first discovering this new frontier. It's connections made in minutes that can last a lifetime.

how-the-arrival-of-web-3-0-is-transformi.title: How the Arrival of Web 3.0 is Transforming Traditional Business Models
how-the-arrival-of-web-3-0-is-transformi.author: Kevin Owocki, Guest Blogger, Founder at GitCoin
how-the-arrival-of-web-3-0-is-transformi.excerpt: Although the Internet continues to drive digital transformation, the technology operates far beyond its original parameters. how-ethical-advertising-will-transform-t.author: Eric Berry, Guest Blogger, Founder at CodeFund

introducing-truffle-db-part-2.excerpt: In the second of this two-part blog post, we go over Truffle DB's data model, interface, and our roadmap to release.

introducing-truffle-db-part-1.author: gnidan (Nick D'Andrea)
introducing-truffle-db-part-1.excerpt: In the first of this two-part blog post, learn about how Truffle manages to make sense of your project and some of the current limitations we hope to solve with our upcoming Truffle DB.

the-blockchain-problem-that-ens-solves.title: The Blockchain UI Problem that ENS Solves
the-blockchain-problem-that-ens-solves.author: Brantly Millegan, guest blogger from Ethereum Name Service
the-blockchain-problem-that-ens-solves.excerpt: The blockchain world has a UI problem. The computer-generated address system works great for computers but isn‚Äôt user-friendly. That‚Äôs where the Ethereum Name Service (ENS) comes in. ENS provides the same basic functionality of DNS (look up the records for ‚Äúexample.tld,‚Äù retrieve information), but replaces the hierarchical DNS server system with a few smart contracts on Ethereum.

the-best-ways-to-contribute-to-truffle.title: The Best Ways to Contribute to Truffle

10-things-we-dont-do-that-make-working-a.title: 10 Things We Don't Do That Make Working at Truffle Awesome
10-things-we-dont-do-that-make-working-a.author: Tim Coulter
10-things-we-dont-do-that-make-working-a.excerpt: At Truffle we have an extremely tight-knit team. ethereum-gas-exactimation.author: Nicholas Paterno & Cruz Molina
ethereum-gas-exactimation.excerpt: At Truffle, we decided such an approach was an unnecessarily CPU-intensive solution to the problem and set out to find a (theoretically) more performant and perfectly accurate way of estimating gas. The result? Gas exactimation.

how-to-get-your-boss-to-send-you-to-truf.title: How to get your boss to send you to TruffleCon
how-to-get-your-boss-to-send-you-to-truf.author: Liz Daldalian
how-to-get-your-boss-to-send-you-to-truf.excerpt: Last year Truffle Suite launched TruffleCon, an event designed for the Truffle community and those interested in building world-changing applications powered by decentralized technologies. truffle-v5-has-arrived.title: Truffle v5 has arrived!

why-were-organizing-trufflecon-2018.title: Why We're Organizing TruffleCon 2018
why-were-organizing-trufflecon-2018.author: Mike Pumphrey
why-were-organizing-trufflecon-2018.excerpt: As you have hopefully heard by now, TruffleCon, Truffle's first-ever user conference, will be on October 5-7, 2018 in Portland, Oregon, U.S.A.

announcing-full-portable-solidity-debugg.title: Announcing our Fully Featured, Portable Solidity Debugger
announcing-full-portable-solidity-debugg.author: Tim Coulter
announcing-full-portable-solidity-debugg.excerpt: Since Truffle's inception, it's been our mission to build outstanding development tools for the Ethereum community. The analogy we always used was one of history: Ethereum development practices are years behind the rest of the industry, and it's our job to build tools that modernize our craft. Well today, Truffle's come one step closer to that goal. We're happy to announce the release of our fully featured, fully portable Solidity debugger and debugging libraries.

drizzle-reactive-ethereum-data-for-front.title: Drizzle: Reactive Ethereum Data for Front-ends
drizzle-reactive-ethereum-data-for-front.author: Josh Quintal
drizzle-reactive-ethereum-data-for-front.excerpt: Today we're proud to announce the addition of a new product to the Truffle Suite: Drizzle. Drizzle is a collection of front-end libraries that make writing dapp front-ends easier and more predictable.

testrpc-is-now-ganache.title: TestRPC is now Ganache
testrpc-is-now-ganache.author: Mike Pumphrey
testrpc-is-now-ganache.excerpt: Have you been looking for the TestRPC recently and haven't been able to find it? Don't worry, it's still here! It's just now known as Ganache. Ganache comes in two flavors: a fully-interactive development blockchain with a graphical interface, and the more familiar command-line version.

first-ever-truffle-retreat.title: Our First Ever Truffle Retreat
first-ever-truffle-retreat.author: Tim Coulter
first-ever-truffle-retreat.excerpt: We recently released Truffle 3.0 in February to much fanfare. As part of that release we separated our codebase into multiple different modules to make integrating with Truffle easier. Those modules now live in the github repository http://github.com/trufflesuite, which hints at our broader mission of providing a comprehensive suite of tools for Ethereum development.

designing-the-ganache-logo.title: Designing the Ganache Logo
designing-the-ganache-logo.author: Josh Quintal
designing-the-ganache-logo.excerpt: Last week we released Ganache, a personal blockchain for Ethereum development. Many of you commented on the design of the landing page and logo, but just how did the gooey cube come to be? Let's take a trip through the 30+ iterations that led to our newest confection.

one-hundred-documentation-pull-requests.title: One hundred documentation pull requests? Yes please.
one-hundred-documentation-pull-requests.author: Mike Pumphrey
one-hundred-documentation-pull-requests.excerpt: Greetings! The Truffle team has been growing over the course of the last year. From a single developer, we are now a team of five (soon to be even more), which means that we can spread the work around. As a new full-time member of the team, I've first taken to looking at our existing materials to ensure that everything is up-to-date and working well. For example, our website, a public GitHub repository, had been receiving pull requests (PRs) for the better part of a year, and they had been languishing for want of someone to go through them.

you-can-now-make-your-own-truffle-box.title: You Can Now Make Your Own Truffle Box
you-can-now-make-your-own-truffle-box.author: Josh Quintal
you-can-now-make-your-own-truffle-box.excerpt: Two months ago we unveiled official integration with Truffle Boxes, example Ethereum applications and/or boilerplates that put complimentary tools and libraries into sweet, easily-downloadable packages. In addition to rolling out some official boxes, Status.im released the first community-supported box. Today we're happy to announce anyone can now make their very own Truffle Box!

learn-ethereum-the-fun-way-with-our-pet-.title: Learn Ethereum The Fun Way with our Pet Shop Tutorial
learn-ethereum-the-fun-way-with-our-pet-.author: Josh Quintal
learn-ethereum-the-fun-way-with-our-pet-.excerpt: Here at Truffle we want to make Ethereum development accessible to developers of all stripes. To that end, today we're releasing a new tutorial called Pet Shop. It covers the entire local development process, start to finish. For added fun, we've tied the whole thing together within the narrative of creating a pet adoption dapp for a local pet shop owner.

truffle-boxes-making-life-sweeter.title: Truffle Boxes: Making Life Sweeter
truffle-boxes-making-life-sweeter.author: Tim Coulter
truffle-boxes-making-life-sweeter.excerpt: When users begin developing on Ethereum, the first question they ask is, "Where do I start?". In the past, there hasn't been an easy answer: the answer generally consisted of many flavors of "it depends", and usually led to an investigation of what the user was trying to build, a general overview of their development skills, their knowledge of Ethereum, and the libraries and tools they're already most comfortable with. When determining how the Truffle team can help in this process, it quickly became apparent that what our users needed were examples. Many of them. So, being the upstanding community members we are, we set out to create those example, and today, we're happy to show you what we've accomplished.

removing-installation-issues-continued-t.title: Removing installation issues, con't: TestRPC
removing-installation-issues-continued-t.author: Tim Coulter
removing-installation-issues-continued-t.excerpt: Update: Since this blog post was published, we have released Ganache a personal blockchain and a replacement to the TestRPC. We have left this post unaltered, but we highly recommend checking out our Working with Ganache page.
